// Android Questions //false Android is developed by Apple Inc. Android apps can only be installed through the Google Play Store. Android apps can run on iOS devices without modification. Android supports only single-threaded applications. //true Kotlin is the official programming language for Android development. Android is an open-source operating system. The Android mascot is named "Andy." Android versions are named after popular desserts. Android Studio is the official IDE for Android development. Android apps can be developed using Java programming language. // iOS Questions //false iOS is the operating system developed by Google. Jailbreaking is the official way to customize and modify iOS devices. Siri is the virtual assistant exclusive to Android devices. iOS is an open-source operating system. iOS apps can run on Android devices without modification. Objective-C is no longer used for iOS app development. iOS supports multitasking for all applications. //true Swift is the primary programming language for iOS development. iOS apps can only be installed through the App Store. Xcode is the official IDE for iOS development.
